body:
Comment 3: 
Thank you for your comments. 

I was suggested in Google+ to do the test that way, ignoring the allocation and the
Push(). I think that your lower timing of 7% of slow down is not because of the
start/stop but because you are also accounting for the Push and the rand.Int, that run
at the same speed than before. 

In any case, it is not a major issue, and the slow down would be diluted if the heap is
really used and not just tested.

Regards.
